intro: Trixago apula var. lutea, commonly known as the Yellow Trixago, is a rare variant of the Trixago apula species native to specific regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and distinctive leaf patterns, which set it apart from other varieties. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its unique coloration and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires careful protection.
